title: Sell German Riesling
metaTitle: Sell German Riesling | Egon Muller, JJ Prum, Keller | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your rare German Riesling. We buy Egon Muller, Keller, JJ Prum, and other top producers. Direct offers for sweet and dry styles.
heroSubhead: We buy collectible Riesling from the Mosel, Rheingau, and Rheinhessen.
introParagraph: German Riesling is among the most age-worthy and complex white wines in the world. We purchase top-tier bottles from legendary producers like Egon Müller, Keller, and J.J. Prüm. Whether you have Trockenbeerenauslese (TBA), Eiswein, or Grosses Gewächs (GG), we offer a direct selling solution.
whatWeBuy: Joh. Jos. Prüm Wehlener Sonnenuhr (Auslese Goldkapsel and above)
whatWeDoNotBuy: Wines with signs of heat damage (seepage)
photoChecklist: Front label showing Prädikat level (Kabinett, Spätlese, etc.)
Capsule condition (Goldkapsel vs standard is important)
conditionFactors: Capsule condition (Lange Goldkapsel signifies a special bottling)
Fill level (even old Riesling should have good fills)
Color of the wine (darkening in Riesling is natural with age but excessive browning may indicate oxidation)
pricingFactors: Producer (Egon Müller and Keller are in a league of their own)
Prädikat level (TBA and Eiswein are the most valuable)

faqs.question: Do you buy dry (Trocken) Riesling?
faqs.answer: Yes, specifically Grosses Gewächs (GG) from top producers like Keller, Wittmann, and Dönnhoff.

faqs.question: Is Egon Müller valuable?
faqs.answer: Yes, Egon Müller Scharzhofberger TBA is one of the most expensive and sought-after white wines in the world.

faqs.question: What is a Goldkapsel?
faqs.answer: A gold capsule usually indicates a higher sweetness or selection tier within the Prädikat level. These are more valuable.

faqs.question: Do you buy older vintages?
faqs.answer: Yes, Riesling ages exceptionally well. We buy well-stored bottles from the 70s, 80s, 90s, and beyond.

faqs.question: What is the AP Number?
faqs.answer: The Amtliche Prüfungsnummer identifies the specific bottling. For producers like J.J. Prüm, different AP numbers for the same wine can mean different auction lots and values.

faqs.question: Do you buy Eiswein?
faqs.answer: Yes, true German Eiswein is rare and collectible.
